Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Autologous Bone Marrow Mononuclear Cells for Critical Limb Ischaemia

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomly assigned to receive intramuscular BMMNCs or control

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomly assigned to receive intramuscular BMMNCs or control (conventional therapy, diluted autologous peripheral blood, or saline)

Objective.evidence: This study assesses the benefits and harms of intramuscular transplantation of autologous bone marrow mononuclear cells (BMMNCs) in CLI patients.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcomes were all-cause mortality, pain, and amputation, evaluated over 12 months.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 176 participants were randomised: 88 to the BMMNC group and 88 to the control group.

Number_Analysed.evidence: The analysis followed an intention-to-treat approach.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Mortality showed no significant difference between groups (RR 1.00, 95% CI 0.15 to 6.63).

Harms.evidence: No significant differences were found in side effects (RR 2.13, 95% CI 0.50 to 8.97).
